member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.SpinnerVisibility
member.summary: Specifies the desired visibility of a spinner within a parent control.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.SpinnerVisibility.Collapsed
member.summary: The spinner should always be hidden.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.SpinnerVisibility.Visible
member.summary: The spinner should always be visible.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.SpinnerVisibility.VisibleWhenActive
member.summary: The spinner should be visible when the parent control has focus or a pointer over it.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.PartEditBoxCommitTriggers
member.summary: Specifies the triggers that force a PartEditBoxBase-derived control to immediately commit any changes.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.PartEditBoxCommitTriggers.None
member.summary: Indicates that changes will only be committed when the control loses focus.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.PartEditBoxCommitTriggers.EnterKeyDown
member.summary: Indicates that changes made will be committed when the Enter key is pressed. Other changes will only be committed when the control loses focus.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.PartEditBoxCommitTriggers.SpinnerChange
member.summary: Indicates that changes made using an associated Spinner will be committed immediately. Other changes will only be committed when the control loses focus.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.PartEditBoxCommitTriggers.ActivePartChange
member.summary: Indicates that changes will be committed when the active part changes. Other changes will only be committed when the control loses focus.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.PartEditBoxCommitTriggers.StringValueChange
member.summary: Indicates that changes will be committed immediately when typing and other text edits occur. Other changes will only be committed when the control loses focus.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.PartEditBoxCommitTriggers.Default

member.summary: Specifies the kind of Style to apply to the used within a 's popup.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.DoubleEditBoxPickerKind.Default
member.summary: Use the Style set to the property, and if that is not specified, uses the default style, which is templated to contain a radial slider control.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.DoubleEditBoxPickerKind.Calculator
member.summary: Uses the Style set to the property, which is templated to contain a calculator control.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.SpinWrapping
member.summary: Specifies the various wrapping behaviors supported when spinning a value in a part edit box.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.SpinWrapping.NoWrap
member.summary: Indicates that the values will not wrap when the minimum or maximum are reached.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.SpinWrapping.SimpleWrap
member.summary: Indicates that the values will wrap when the minimum or maximum are reached (e.g. incrementing the maximum value will result in the minimum value).
member.remarks: Some types can support more advanced wrapping behaviors, such as DateTime. For example, if you increment the minute part of the time "4:59pm", then there are three possible outcomes: 1. "4:59pm" - This is equivalent to the NoWrap option. 2. "4:00pm" - This is equivalent to the SimpleWrap option. 3. "5:00pm" - This is equivalent to the Wrap option, which affects the hour part.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Editors.SpinWrapping.Wrap
member.summary: Indicates that the values will wrap when the minimum or maximum are reached (e.g. incrementing the maximum value will result in the minimum value), but may or may not include special handling (see remarks for more information).
member.remarks: Some types can support more advanced wrapping behaviors, such as DateTime. For example, if you increment the minute part of the time "4:59pm", then there are three possible outcomes: 1. "4:59pm" - This is equivalent to the NoWrap option. 2. "4:00pm" - This is equivalent to the SimpleWrap option. 3. "5:00pm" - This is equivalent to the Wrap option, which affects the hour part.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Products.Editors.SR
member.summary: Provides access to the string resources of this assembly, also allowing for their customization.
member.remarks:
Call the method to return a resolved resource string. If a custom string has been set for a specified string resource name, it will be returned. Otherwise, the default string resource value is returned.
If any of the resource strings are customized via a call to , it is best to do so before any other classes in this assembly are referenced, such as in the application startup.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Products.Editors.SR.ClearCustomStrings
member.summary: Removes all custom strings.

member.summary: Returns whether a custom string is defined for the specified string resource.
member.param: The name of the resource for which to search.
member.returns: true if a custom string is defined for the specified string resource; otherwise, false.

member.param: The name of the resource to get.
member.returns: The custom string that is stored for the specified string resource, if any.

member.param: The name of the resource to get.
member.returns: The value of the resource localized for the caller's current culture settings. If a best match is not possible, is returned.
